translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 「このまま……
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: "Just like this..."

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: ただケッセルリンク様の
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: Simply by staying by Lord Kesselring's side

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: お側にいられる永遠を」
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: an eternity of being close to him."

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 「ケッセルリンク様に限っては同意だし私も好き。
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: "I agree when it comes to Lord Kesselring, and I like him too.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: でも変化がなきゃ飽きちゃいますよ」
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: But without any changes, I get bored."

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 「うふふ、貴方達はまだ若いものね。
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: "Ufufu, you all are still young, after all.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 1000年も生きれば分かるわ」
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: If you live for a thousand years, you'll understand."

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 「ふん、すぐに年長ぶって。
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: "Hmph, pretending to be senior so quickly.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: そんなの意味ないのに」
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: That doesn't mean anything."

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 「はいはい、それじゃ何をお話しようかしらね」
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: "Alright, alright, then what shall we talk about?"

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: お話を始めようとしている三人に、
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: To the three who were about to start talking,

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 紅茶を持つ加奈代が声をかける。
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: Kanayo, carrying tea, spoke up.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 「そういえば二人はもう、
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: "By the way, have you two already,

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: みんなの過去のことは知ってたかしら？」
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: known about everyone's past?"

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 「いいえー」
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: "No."

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 「わざわざ聞くようなことでもないかと思って、
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: "I thought it wasn't something to go out of our way to ask about,

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: チラホラとしか聞いたことはありません」
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: so I've only heard bits and pieces here and there."

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 「そうねぇ、もう500年以上は一緒なんだし、
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: "Well, we've been together for over 500 years,

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 気にしてる子もいないでしょうし。
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: and I guess no one really cares about it.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: いいんじゃないですか、シャロンさん」
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: Isn't that alright, Sharon?"

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 「そうねぇ……
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: "Well then...

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: それじゃあ、パレロアの話でも……」
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: how about a story about Paleroa...?"

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 「ふふ、パレロアさん、
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: "Hehe, did you notice that Paleroa-san

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 二人に特別優しいってこと気づいていた？」
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: is especially kind to the two of you?"

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 「まあ、なんとなく……」
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: "Well, somehow, yes..."

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 「よく叱られますけどね」
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: "Though I get scolded often."

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 「彼女は私達の中で唯一子供を産んだことがあるから
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: "She's the only one among us who has ever given birth,

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 幼い子が相手だと、どうしても、ね。
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: so when dealing with young children, she naturally...

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: そういうところがあるみたいなの」
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: has that kind of disposition."

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 「え、子持ちだったんですか？」
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: "Eh, she had children?"

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 「じゃあ、その、結婚相手も？」
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: "Then, um, did she have a husband as well?"

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 「いたそうよ、お見合いらしいけど。
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: "She did, apparently by arranged marriage.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 当時の高名な魔法関係の研究者だとか」
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: It was said to be a famous magic researcher at the time."

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 「彼女は夫に尽くしたし、子宝にも恵まれた。
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: "She devoted herself to her husband and was blessed with children.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 一見、順風満帆な人生だったんだけど……」
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: At first glance, it was a smooth and fortunate life, but..."

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 「双子の娘達を夫の研究の実験台にされて、
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: "Her twin daughters were used as test subjects in her husband's research,

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 娘達は見るも無惨な
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: and the daughters were horribly

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 肉瘤だらけの化け物のような姿にされた」
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: transformed into monster-like creatures covered in flesh tumors."

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 「思わず彼女は夫を殺し、
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: "Uncontrollably, she killed her husband,

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: まだ赤子の子供達を連れて、
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: and took her infant children,

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 街を飛び出したんですって」
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: and fled the city."

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 「子供達の見た目のせいでどこの地でも迫害され、
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: "Because of the children's appearance, they were persecuted everywhere,

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: ついには人里から離れた
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: and eventually forced to live

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 山小屋生活にまで追い込まれ……
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: in a mountain hut far from human settlements..."

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 「元々生き物として無理があったんでしょうね。
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: "Originally, their existence as living beings was probably unnatural.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 赤子は一月後に自然死」
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: The infant died naturally after one month."

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 「全てを失ったパレロアさんが
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: "Having lost everything, Paleroa-san

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 魔物に食い殺されようと魔物界の森を歩いていて、
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: was walking through the demon realm forest, about to be devoured by monsters,

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: ケッセルリンク様とお会いしたとか」
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: when she met Lord Kesselring."

translationLines.description: Array of objects, each representing a line from the input

originalJapaneseLine.description: The original line in Japanese exactly as it was in the input

translatedEnglishLine.description: The original line translated to English

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 幼い子が相手だと、どうしても、ね。
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: so when dealing with young children, she naturally...

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: そういうところがあるみたいなの」
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: has that kind of disposition."

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 「え、子持ちだったんですか？」
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: "Eh, she had children?"

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 「じゃあ、その、結婚相手も？」
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: "Then, um, did she have a husband as well?"

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 「いたそうよ、お見合いらしいけど。
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: "She did, apparently by arranged marriage.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 当時の高名な魔法関係の研究者だとか」
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: It was said to be a famous magic researcher at the time."

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 「彼女は夫に尽くしたし、子宝にも恵まれた。
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: "She devoted herself to her husband and was blessed with children.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 一見、順風満帆な人生だったんだけど……」
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: At first glance, it was a smooth and fortunate life, but..."

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 「双子の娘達を夫の研究の実験台にされて、
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: "Her twin daughters were used as test subjects in her husband's research,

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 娘達は見るも無惨な
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: and the daughters were horribly

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 肉瘤だらけの化け物のような姿にされた」
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: transformed into monster-like creatures covered in flesh tumors."

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 「思わず彼女は夫を殺し、
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: "Uncontrollably, she killed her husband,

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: まだ赤子の子供達を連れて、
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: and took her infant children,

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 街を飛び出したんですって」
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: and fled the city."

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 「子供達の見た目のせいでどこの地でも迫害され、
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: "Because of the children's appearance, they were persecuted everywhere,

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: ついには人里から離れた
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: and eventually forced to live

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 山小屋生活にまで追い込まれ……
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: in a mountain hut far from human settlements..."

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 「元々生き物として無理があったんでしょうね。
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: "Originally, their existence as living beings was probably unnatural.

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 赤子は一月後に自然死」
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: The infant died naturally after one month."

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 「全てを失ったパレロアさんが
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: "Having lost everything, Paleroa-san

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: 魔物に食い殺されようと魔物界の森を歩いていて、
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: was walking through the demon realm forest, about to be devoured by monsters,

translationLines.originalJapaneseLine: ケッセルリンク様とお会いしたとか」
translationLines.translatedEnglishLine: when she met Lord Kesselring."
